statement.title: Content
statement.content:
Problems involving the computation of exact values of very large magnitude and precision are common. For example, the computation of the national debt is a taxing experience for many computer systems. 

This problem requires that you write a program to compute the exact value of $R^n$ where $R$ is a real number ($0.0 < R < 99.999$) and $n$ is an integer such that $0 < n \le 25$.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content: The input will consist of a set of pairs of values for $R$ and $n$. The $R$ value will occupy columns $1$ through $6$, and the $n$ value will be in columns $8$ and $9$.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: The output will consist of one line for each line of input giving the exact value of $R^n$. Leading zeros should be suppressed in the output. Insignificant trailing zeros must not be printed. Don't print the decimal point if the result is an integer.
